thread.title: Fury after Domino's staff buy supplies in ALDI | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Fury after Domino's staff buy supplies in ALDI | Daily Mail Online

author: Rachael Burford For Mailonline
title: Fury after Domino's staff buy supplies in ALDI | Daily Mail Online
text: comments A man in a Domino's uniform was photographed by a disgruntled shopper stocking up on Aldi chicken An angry shopper complained to Domino's after she saw a 'sheepish-looking' member of staff piling a shopping trolley full of hundreds of chicken wings and coleslaw from Aldi. Caroline Foskett, 31, was shopping in the Aldi in Dartford, Kent, on Friday when she spotted a man wearing a Domino's uniform 'awkwardly wandering up and down the aisles' with a trolley. The man appeared to be waiting for Aldi staff to restock the freezer after he had emptied it of chicken wings and dippers. Teacher Ms Foskett, from London , claims he already had six or seven tubs of coleslaw, eight or nine boxes of chicken strips and the same same amount of chicken wings before he loaded in even more. The mother-of-two sent the fast food giant a photo of the worker when she saw Domino's hit the headlines last week after staff were spotted bulk-buying £1 bags of potato wedges in Asda. However, Domino's claimed the member of staff was conducting his personal grocery shop because bottles of water are visible in the trolley, which they don't sell. Ms Foskett said: 'No-one needs that much chicken for themselves. Caroline Foskett (pictured left) was shopping on Friday when she photographed the worker (right) who appeared to be waiting for Aldi staff to restock the freezer after he had emptied it of chicken wings and dippers The mother-of-two was shopping in the Aldi in Dartford, Kent (pictured) and sent the fast food giant a photo of the man after she saw Domino's hit the headlines last week when staff were spotted bulk-buying £1 bags of potato wedges in Asda 'I just couldn't believe it when I saw him with a trolley full of frozen chicken - especially after the photo of the Domino's staff member stocking up on wedges last week. I thought "as if they're doing it again". 'We used to get pizzas on the weekend because my husband works then and we'd spend well over £20, but now I'm not so sure. 'He certainly looked a bit sheepish, like he was trying to be very discreet. Domino's sell portions of coleslaw (left) for £1.99 each and seven chicken strippers (right) cost £4.99 Ms Foskett claims the Domino's worker had about eight or nine boxes of chicken strips and a similar amount of legs. Aldi sell six chicken goujons (pictured) for £1.15 RELATED ARTICLES
